html Seacom restored via alternative routes Seacom announced that it has fully restored all its customers on alternative routes October 20 , 2011 Subsea cable operator , Seacom , announced on Twitter today ( 20 October 2011 ) that they have restored services to all customers using alternate routes , following an <CAUSE> outage </CAUSE> that was initially expected to take 12 days to repair . html Seacom restored via alternative routes Seacom announced that it has fully restored all its customers on alternative routes October 20 , 2011 Subsea cable operator , Seacom , announced on Twitter today ( 20 October 2011 ) that they have restored services to all customers using alternate routes , following an <CAUSE> outage </CAUSE> that was initially expected to take 12 days to repair . html Major fire at supermarket Sunday , July 21 , 2013 FIRE crews from Tiverton and Cullompton were this morning <CAUSE> called in </CAUSE> to help fight a major blaze at the Waitrose supermarket in Wellington . The fire has destroyed a large section of the store and fire crews and investigators are still on the scene . Two engines were sent to the store after several members of the public called emergency services at 6am . When they arrived they called in an additional six engines , an aerial platform and an incident command vehicle . A corner of the building measuring 50m by 50m containing food was well alight . By 6 . 30am the <EFFECT> fire </EFFECT> had been contained using water and foam and police had been called .
FALLING_ACTION

30am crews were using thermal imaging cameras to identify hotspots and an <CAUSE> investigation </CAUSE> into the cause of the <EFFECT> fire </EFFECT> was under way .

html Major fire at supermarket Sunday , July 21 , 2013 FIRE crews from Tiverton and Cullompton were this morning called in to help <CAUSE> fight </CAUSE> a major <EFFECT> blaze </EFFECT> at the Waitrose supermarket in Wellington .
FALLING_ACTION

30am the <CAUSE> fire </CAUSE> had been contained using water and foam and police had been called . Half an hour later a second aerial platform was called in . and hydrants were being used for extra water . Police advised local residents to shut all doors and windows . Just before 8am crews requested the attendance of an incident support unit from Yeovil for additional drinking water , firefighter welfare and salvage equipment . By 8 . 30am crews were using thermal imaging cameras to identify hotspots and an <EFFECT> investigation </EFFECT> into the cause of the fire was under way .

htm Hawaiian Gardens Gang Member Charged with Murdering Sheriff ’ s Deputy July 26 , 2005 District Attorney Steve Cooley announced today that capital murder charges were filed against a Hawaiian Gardens gang member <CAUSE> accused </CAUSE> of <EFFECT> gunning down </EFFECT> Deputy Luis Gerardo ( Jerry ) Ortiz a month ago .
FALLING_ACTION

Cooley said Jose Luis Orozco was charged with <CAUSE> murdering </CAUSE> the 35 - year - old deputy on June 24 outside a Hawaiian Gardens apartment . The complaint alleged three special circumstances that would make Orozco eligible for the death penalty : murder of a peace officer during performance of his duties , lying in wait and murder to avoid arrest . “ Deputy Ortiz was killed while investigating a shooting in which the defendant was a suspect , ” Cooley said at a news conference at the Bellflower courthouse . “ He was <EFFECT> shot </EFFECT> in the head and left dying on the ground while his killer ran away and tried to hide .
FALLING_ACTION

“ The defendant ’ s custody status gave Sheriff ’ s detectives and our prosecutors in the Crimes Against Police Officers Section ( CAPOS ) additional time to fully investigate this murder and the case on which Deputy Ortiz was <CAUSE> working </CAUSE> when he was <EFFECT> killed </EFFECT> , ” Cooley said .

com / news / 062405 - sheriffs - deputy Sheriff ’ s Deputy Shot and Killed June 24 , 2005 A 35 - year - old sheriff ’ s deputy working with an anti - gang unit was killed Friday when he knocked on the door of a home and someone <CAUSE> shot </CAUSE> him in the head , authorities said . Deputy Jerry Ortiz had gone to the home to speak to a woman there as part of a gang investigation when he was attacked , Undersheriff Larry Waldie told reporters Friday night . Ortiz probably died instantly , Waldie said . “ Someone <EFFECT> came out </EFFECT> either nearby or from the residence and put a bullet through his head , ” Waldie said .

com / story / 2007 / 04 / 11 / detroit - office - shooter - charged - with - murder - attempted - murder / Detroit Office Shooter Charged With Murder , Attempted Murder Published April 11 , 2007 A man fired four days earlier from his job as an accountant walked into his old office , passed by the receptionist and made his way to a manager's office with the purpose of <CAUSE> killing </CAUSE> him with a shotgun , a police sergeant said Wednesday during the man's arraignment . When Monday's violence had concluded , the receptionist - - Madeline Kafoury - - was shot dead and two managers , Paul Riva and Alan Steinberg , were wounded . Steinberg was shot in the hip and has spoken to police about the attack , while Riva had not yet regained consciousness and was on a ventilator . The man accused of <EFFECT> shooting </EFFECT> his three former co - workers is Anthony LaCalamita III , a 38 - year - old Troy resident who was fired from Gordon Advisors on Thursday .

November 28 , 2005 Ten people were killed and at least 50 injured when an <EFFECT> earthquake </EFFECT> razed mud - brick villages on the Persian Gulf island of Qeshm off Iran's southern coast Sunday , officials and state media said .
FALLING_ACTION

"The <CAUSE> earthquake </CAUSE> was really strong , and people poured into the streets in panic . My husband immediately rushed off to one of the stricken villages , " said Sara Sadeqi , 22 , a homemaker in Qeshm City . State television quoted the disaster center in the province of Hormozgan as saying 10 people were killed . Qeshm Gov . Heidar Alishvandi said 50 were <EFFECT> injured </EFFECT> .

November 28 , 2005 Ten people were killed and at least 50 injured when an <CAUSE> earthquake </CAUSE> razed mud - brick villages on the Persian Gulf island of Qeshm off Iran's southern coast Sunday , officials and state media said . Tehran's seismologic center put the quake's magnitude at 5 . 9 , but the U . S . Geological Survey in Golden , Colo . , said it was 6 . 1 . A magnitude 6 quake can cause severe damage . The temblor was felt across the gulf in Oman and the United Arab Emirates . State - run TV reported that the island's airport sustained minor damage , and part of a hospital <EFFECT> collapsed </EFFECT> .

stm Last Updated : Monday , 28 November 2005 , 02 : 24 GMT Ten dead in southern Iran quake A powerful earthquake has hit southern Iran , killing at least 10 people , <CAUSE> injuring </CAUSE> dozens more and damaging several villages , officials say . The 6 . 1 - magnitude quake struck Qeshm island , home to 120 , 000 people , and the city of Bandar Abbas , state media said . On Qeshm island , between half and two - thirds of homes in five villages had been damaged , officials said . The <EFFECT> quake </EFFECT> , which struck at 1353 ( 1023 GMT ) , was felt in the neighbouring Gulf states of Oman and the UAE .

Heydar Alishbandi , Governor of Qeshm island , said five villages had been badly hit , but the worst - <CAUSE> affected </CAUSE> areas appeared to be in the less - populated west . Helicopters ferried the injured to hospital but the authorities say the rescue effort is now winding down . Mr Alishbandi told the AFP news agency he was not expecting the death toll to rise . The BBC's Frances Harrison in Tehran says in one incident a number of children suffered broken legs as they rushed to evacuate their school . The initial <EFFECT> tremor </EFFECT> lasted just over 10 seconds , she says , and there have been at least four aftershocks of around 4 .

The seismological bases of Tehran University registered a quake measuring 3 . 8 on the Richter scale at 09 : 10 hours ( 0440 GMT ) on Monday . The earthquake knocked down power in rural areas , <EFFECT> sinking </EFFECT> them into darkness .

9 <CAUSE> earthquake </CAUSE> early Sunday afternoon . The seismological bases of Tehran University registered a quake measuring 3 . 8 on the Richter scale at 09 : 10 hours ( 0440 GMT ) on Monday . The earthquake knocked down power in rural areas , sinking them into darkness . Local officials were struggling Monday to restore electricity . Flights from and into the International Qeshm Airport were resumed Monday morning . The airport received minor damage in the quake . The tremor also damaged hospitals on the island , including one which was reported to have stopped providing medical <EFFECT> service </EFFECT> .

PRECONDITION

9 shook a sparsely populated area of southern Iran on Sunday , flattening seven villages and <CAUSE> killing </CAUSE> 10 people , officials said . The temblor was felt as far away as Oman and the United Arab Emirates . Heidar Alishvandi , the governor of Qeshm , was quoted by state - run television as saying rescue teams were deployed to the affected area and people in the wrecked villages moved quickly to safely . Another provincial official , Ghasem Karami , told The Associated Press that high casualties were not expected because the area was not heavily developed . Tehran's seismologic center said the <EFFECT> quake </EFFECT> measured magnitude - 5 .

PRECONDITION

9 shook a sparsely populated area of southern Iran on Sunday , <CAUSE> flattening </CAUSE> seven villages and killing 10 people , officials said . The temblor was felt as far away as Oman and the United Arab Emirates . Heidar Alishvandi , the governor of Qeshm , was quoted by state - run television as saying rescue teams were deployed to the affected area and people in the wrecked villages moved quickly to safely . Another provincial official , Ghasem Karami , told The Associated Press that high casualties were not expected because the area was not heavily developed . Tehran's seismologic center said the <EFFECT> quake </EFFECT> measured magnitude - 5 .

563290 Posted : Nov 27 , 2005 8 : 20 AM ET Last Updated : Nov 27 , 2005 8 : 10 PM ET An <CAUSE> earthquake </CAUSE> with a magnitude of at least 5 . 9 hit southern Iran on Sunday , killing at least 10 people and injuring many others . The quake was centred near Qeshm Island , home to 200 , 000 people , the U . S . Geological Survey said . Buildings were <EFFECT> toppled </EFFECT> in the island's capital , Qeshm City , as well as in the the villages of Tonban , Gavarzin and Khaledi .
PRECONDITION

Buildings were <CAUSE> toppled </CAUSE> in the island's capital , Qeshm City , as well as in the the villages of Tonban , Gavarzin and Khaledi . The main hospital on Qeshm was having trouble keeping up with the number of injured , Iran's official news agency IRNA said . It's "full of wounded , " the agency reported . The quake also shook the major port city of Bandar Abbas and was felt in nearby countries . In Oman and the United Arab Emirates , buildings were evacuated and people fled into the streets . An office worker in Dubai said the <EFFECT> tremor </EFFECT> lasted 30 seconds and was strong enough to shake buildings along the skyscraper - lined central business district .

res=9A0DE2DE1431F93BA15752C1A9639C8B63 Powerful <CAUSE> Quake </CAUSE> in Iran Kills 10 ; 80 <EFFECT> Hurt </EFFECT> and 7 Villages Damaged Published : November 28 , 2005 A powerful earthquake hit southern Iran on Sunday , causing major destruction in seven villages and killing 10 people and injuring 80 .
PRECONDITION

The tourist Island of Qeshm on the Persian Gulf and seven of its villages were most strongly affected by the <CAUSE> quake </CAUSE> . It hit at 1 : 53 p . m . local time and was followed by at least four strong aftershocks , IRNA reported . The news agency also reported that one of the major hospitals on the island , in the village of Jeyhian , was <EFFECT> destroyed </EFFECT> and the village's power lines were cut .

<CAUSE> It </CAUSE> hit at 1 : 53 p . m . local time and was followed by at least four strong aftershocks , IRNA reported . The news agency also reported that one of the major hospitals on the island , in the village of Jeyhian , was destroyed and the village's power lines were cut . The island's airport was also damaged . Abdolreza Sheikholeslami , the governor of Hormozgan Province , the center of the damaged area , said 40 percent to 70 percent of the buildings in seven villages were <EFFECT> destroyed </EFFECT> , IRNA reported .

com / story / 1139218 / paris - jewellery - stolen - in - casty - shop - raid Paris : Jewellery Stolen In Casty Shop Raid 11 : 39am UK , Monday 09 September 2013 Four men smash their car into a jewellery store before <CAUSE> fleeing </CAUSE> in a different vehicle in the latest high - profile heist in France . Jewellery and watches worth £1 . 7m have been stolen during a heist in an upmarket central Paris shop . Four men drove a 4x4 through the front window of the store on Rue de Castiglione , before making off with the jewellery and watches . They then set fire to the vehicle before fleeing in another car . Forensic policemen are examining the Casty store in the central first district of the capital , home to numerous jewellery shops . The <EFFECT> heist </EFFECT> near Place Vendome is the latest to hit France after a spate of high - profile robberies in the southern resort of Cannes .

6 Million Jewelry <CAUSE> Heist </CAUSE> September 9 , 2013 Four men rammed their car into an upmarket jewelry store in central Paris on Monday , smashing the shop window and stealing $2 . 6 million ( two million Euros ) in jewelry , according to AFP . The heist near Place Vendome is the latest to hit France after a string of high - profile robberies in Cannes . He was at large until Dec . 7 , when he was found shoeless , wet and hungry at a north Houston business , where he asked to use the phone . So far , 11 Estelle unit employees have been recommended for termination or faced consequences related to Comeaux's escape . , riding in wheelchair , <CAUSE> pulls </CAUSE> gun on guards , escapes on foot THURSDAY , DECEMBER 3 , 2009 , 9 : 36 AM Rewards totaling $30 , 000 are offered for information leading to Texas prison escapee Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr . Department of Corrections spokeswoman Michelle Lyons said Thursday that the convicted sex offender was still on the run . Comeaux was in a wheelchair Monday when he pulled a gun on two guards during a transfer from a unit in Huntsville to one in Beaumont . Both guards were released after being forced to drive to the Baytown area , where Comeaux <EFFECT> ran </EFFECT> way .

TDCJ officials could answer few questions about how convicted rapist Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr . , 49 , escaped Monday from a prison van in Baytown after pulling a gun and handcuffing two transport officers , stealing their three guns and walking away . He remains on the loose today . In a statement published on its official website , Seacom said that a repair vessel is now in transit . "The vessel has received the master permit for this repair ; operational permits are being finalized and should be received prior to arrival on the repair ground , " Seacom said . The <EFFECT> repair </EFFECT> is now expected to be completed in late October , but Seacom warned that "the usual exogenous factors associated with sub - sea repairs , including weather and currents , may further impact the repair .

newsID=30873 Submarine cable problem <CAUSE> disrupts </CAUSE> telecom services in Alexandria Thursday , Aug 18 , 2011 <EFFECT> Services </EFFECT> on Egypt's three telecom operators were disrupted in parts of Alexandria on Tuesday afternoon , and some users in Cairo experienced slower internet connections due to "downtime" in a submarine cable .
PRECONDITION

Vodafone Egypt said some users are continuing to face slight problems due to <CAUSE> damage </CAUSE> in Telecom Egypt's cables which began in central Cairo . "Vodafone , along with the country's three telecom providers has been affected by a damage in one of Telecom Egypt's fiber cables in a wire going from the Ramsis Communications Center all the way to Sadat City , " said Khaled Hegazy , Vodafone's external affairs director . "This has affected and continues to <EFFECT> affect </EFFECT> communications especially in parts of Alexandria and Suez governorates , " he said .

"Vodafone , along with the country's three telecom providers has been affected by a <CAUSE> damage </CAUSE> in one of Telecom Egypt's fiber cables in a wire going from the Ramsis Communications Center all the way to Sadat City , " said Khaled Hegazy , Vodafone's external affairs director . "This has affected and continues to <EFFECT> affect </EFFECT> communications especially in parts of Alexandria and Suez governorates , " he said .
PRECONDITION

Vodafone Egypt said some users are continuing to face slight problems due to <CAUSE> damage </CAUSE> in Telecom Egypt's cables which began in central Cairo . "Vodafone , along with the country's three telecom providers has been <EFFECT> affected </EFFECT> by a damage in one of Telecom Egypt's fiber cables in a wire going from the Ramsis Communications Center all the way to Sadat City , " said Khaled Hegazy , Vodafone's external affairs director .

Yesterday , Armstead told jurors at the Brooklyn Supreme Court <CAUSE> trial </CAUSE> about the moment she was struck in the <EFFECT> shooting </EFFECT> , which was allegedly sparked by a gangland territorial beef .
FALLING_ACTION

The disturbing evidence was made public at the trial of the two men <CAUSE> accused </CAUSE> of killing Zurana Horton from a Brownsville rooftop in 2011 . Horton , 34 , was walking with one of her 12 children when Andrew Lopez , 20 , fired from the rooftop on the orders of his brother Jonathan Carrasquillo , 24 , prosecutors charge . Also shot were a woman named Unique Armstead , who was walking near Horton , and an 11 - year - old girl who was passing by . Yesterday , Armstead told jurors at the Brooklyn Supreme Court trial about the moment she was <EFFECT> struck </EFFECT> in the shooting , which was allegedly sparked by a gangland territorial beef .

ece INDONESIA , July 2 , 2013 Updated : July 2 , 2013 15 : 01 IST Strong earthquake hits Indonesia's Aceh province A strong earthquake struck off Indonesia's Aceh province on Tuesday , <CAUSE> damaging </CAUSE> houses and injuring at least five people . The U . S . Geological Survey said the magnitude 6 . 1 quake struck at a depth of 10 kilometers ( 6 miles ) and <EFFECT> its </EFFECT> epicenter was located 55 kilometers ( 34 miles ) west of the town of Bireun on the western tip of Sumatra island .
FALLING_ACTION

Geological Survey said the <CAUSE> magnitude 6 . 1 quake </CAUSE> struck at a depth of 10 kilometers ( 6 miles ) and its epicenter was located 55 kilometers ( 34 miles ) west of the town of Bireun on the western tip of Sumatra island . At least five people were reportedly injured and 10 houses were <EFFECT> damaged </EFFECT> in Takengon , the capital of Central Aceh district , said Sutopo Purwo Nugroho of the National Disaster Mitigation Agency .

Geological Survey said the magnitude 6 . 1 quake struck at a depth of 10 kilometers ( 6 miles ) and its epicenter was located 55 kilometers ( 34 miles ) west of the town of Bireun on the western tip of Sumatra island . At least five people were reportedly injured and 10 houses were <EFFECT> damaged </EFFECT> in Takengon , the capital of Central Aceh district , said Sutopo Purwo Nugroho of the National Disaster Mitigation Agency .

At least five people were reportedly injured and 10 houses were damaged in Takengon , the capital of Central Aceh district , said Sutopo Purwo Nugroho of the National Disaster Mitigation Agency . "Many people were <EFFECT> injured </EFFECT> but it is difficult to evacuate them due to traffic jams .
PRECONDITION

In 2004 , a huge earthquake off Aceh triggered a <CAUSE> tsunami </CAUSE> that <EFFECT> killed </EFFECT> 230 , 000 people across Asia .

The U . S . Geological Survey said the magnitude 6 . 1 quake struck at a depth of 10 kilometers ( 6 miles ) and its epicenter was located 55 kilometers ( 34 miles ) west of the town of Bireun on the western tip of Sumatra island . At least five people were reportedly injured and 10 houses were <EFFECT> damaged </EFFECT> in Takengon , the capital of Central Aceh district , said Sutopo Purwo Nugroho of the National Disaster Mitigation Agency .

The <CAUSE> quake </CAUSE> hit inland at 0737 GMT at a depth of just 10 kilometres , 55 kilometres south of Bireun and 72 kilometres southeast of Reuleuet , the US Geological Survey said . "We have received around 50 people with injuries suffered when the walls of their houses collapsed , " Ema Suryani , a doctor at a health clinic in Lampahan city , Bener Meriah district , told AFP . "The injuries vary from open wounds to broken bones . " Injured people had been transported from several affected villages in two trucks , she said . Police said two women and one man died at a branch of the Marfin bank which <EFFECT> caught fire </EFFECT> after rioters broke a window and threw Molotov cocktails inside .

htm Three die in bank during Greek riots Updated 5 / 5 / 2010 1 : 41 PM Riots over harsh new austerity measures left three bank workers dead and engulfed the streets of Athens on Wednesday , as angry protesters tried to <CAUSE> storm </CAUSE> parliament , hurled Molotov cocktails at police and torched buildings . Police responded with barrages of tear gas . Tens of thousands of people took to the streets in a nationwide strike to <EFFECT> protest </EFFECT> new taxes and government spending cuts demanded by the International Monetary Fund and other European nations before heavily indebted Greece gets a euro110 billion ( $141 billion ) loan package to keep it from defaulting .
FALLING_ACTION

Tens of thousands of people took to the streets in a nationwide strike to <CAUSE> protest </CAUSE> new taxes and government spending cuts demanded by the International Monetary Fund and other European nations before heavily indebted Greece gets a euro110 billion ( $141 billion ) loan package to keep it from defaulting . The three bank workers a man and two women <EFFECT> died </EFFECT> after demonstrators set their bank on fire along the main demonstration route in central Athens .
PRECONDITION

htm Three die in bank during Greek riots Updated 5 / 5 / 2010 1 : 41 PM Riots over harsh new austerity measures left three bank workers dead and engulfed the streets of Athens on Wednesday , as angry protesters tried to storm parliament , <CAUSE> hurled </CAUSE> Molotov cocktails at police and torched buildings . Police responded with barrages of tear gas . Tens of thousands of people took to the streets in a nationwide strike to protest new taxes and government spending cuts demanded by the International Monetary Fund and other European nations before heavily indebted Greece gets a euro110 billion ( $141 billion ) loan package to keep it from defaulting . The three bank workers a man and two women died after demonstrators <EFFECT> set their bank on fire </EFFECT> along the main demonstration route in central Athens .

au / newstest2 / archive - old - assets / three - dead - after - fire - bomb - hits - bank - during - greek - riots / story - e6frfkyi - 1225862790476 Three dead after fire - bomb hits bank during Greek <CAUSE> riots </CAUSE> A FIRE - BOMB attack on a bank in Athens left at least three people dead as police fought pitched battles with striking protesters furious at brutal spending cuts designed to avoid national bankruptcy . Hooded youths hurled petrol bombs at stores and businesses in the Greek capital , setting the bank and two government buildings ablaze . Protesters also tried to storm the Greek Parliament and the rioting spread to Greece's second city , Thessaloniki . Police said at least three people , a man and two women , were killed in the fire - bomb <EFFECT> attack </EFFECT> .

The three bank workers - two women and a man - were killed when their branch <EFFECT> went up in flames </EFFECT> after a protester threw a petrol bomb inside .

According to news reports that began at 14 : 00 Greek time after , under pressure by the events , most radio and TV stations decided to break their strike , claim that the <CAUSE> fire </CAUSE> at Marfin Bank's Stadiou street branch that has led to the death of three workers ( one a pregnant woman ) was started by protesters . However this remains an unsubstantiated claim . A similar case three decades ago had originally put the blame for the fire at Kappa - Marousi building on Panepistimiou street , leading to the death of several people inside , to anarchists , while its was later proved the fire was caused by tear gas fired by the police . After the tragic <EFFECT> death </EFFECT> of the three workers made the round of Athens , new clashes started to spread in the Greek capital , with a large crowd gathered outside the burned bank when Marfin's boss tried to visit the site .

com / world / 2010 / 05 / 05 / brigade - says - person - dead - bank - riots - demonstration / Greek Prime Minister Calls Bank Workers' Riot Deaths 'Murder' Published May 05 , 2010 The Greek prime minister has denounced what he called the "murder" of three bank workers <CAUSE> killed </CAUSE> when the building they were in was torched during protests in Athens against harsh new austerity measures . Prime Minister George Papandreou vowed Wednesday that those responsible for the deaths would be found and brought to justice . He told Parliament that "a demonstration is one thing and murder is quite another . " The two women and a man were killed during <EFFECT> demonstrations </EFFECT> by tens of thousands who marched through Athens .

Three people died when an Athens bank went up in flames Wednesday as tens of thousands of Greeks took to the streets to <CAUSE> protest </CAUSE> harsh spending <EFFECT> cuts </EFFECT> aimed at saving the country from bankruptcy .

com / world / 2010 / 05 / 05 / brigade - says - person - dead - bank - riots - demonstration / Greek Prime Minister Calls Bank Workers' Riot Deaths 'Murder' Published May 05 , 2010 The Greek prime minister has denounced what he called the "murder" of three bank workers killed when the building they were in was <CAUSE> torched </CAUSE> during protests in Athens against harsh new austerity measures . Prime Minister George Papandreou vowed Wednesday that those responsible for the deaths would be found and brought to justice . He told Parliament that "a demonstration is one thing and murder is quite another . " The two women and a man were killed during demonstrations by tens of thousands who marched through Athens . The national strike was held to protest the austerity measures announced last weekend so that Greece can get a $144 billion bailout from the International Monetary fund and other European nations . Three people <EFFECT> died </EFFECT> when an Athens bank went up in flames Wednesday as tens of thousands of Greeks took to the streets to protest harsh spending cuts aimed at saving the country from bankruptcy .

com / world / 2010 / 05 / 05 / brigade - says - person - dead - bank - riots - demonstration / Greek Prime Minister Calls Bank Workers' Riot Deaths 'Murder' Published May 05 , 2010 The Greek prime minister has denounced what he called the "murder" of three bank workers killed when the building they were in was torched during <CAUSE> protests </CAUSE> in Athens against harsh new austerity measures . Prime Minister George Papandreou vowed Wednesday that those responsible for the deaths would be found and brought to justice .
